Keywords: Avengers , Cosmic , Kree , Negative Zone , Soldier
Real Name: Mar-Vell
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Captain
THE KREE-SKRULL WAR: FREE: Choose an opposing character within range. The chosen character can't use Super Senses or Shape Change when targeted by Mar-Vell and friendly Sidekicks this turn.
THE RETURN OF MAR-VELL: The first time Mar-Vell would be KO'd, instead turn him to click #8 then roll a d6 and heal him equal to half the result. If Mar-Vell is 125 points, instead heal him equal to the result. Protected: Pulse Wave.
CAPTAIN OF THE KREE EMPIRE: Leadership. When Mar-Vell uses it and succeeds, you may instead generate a AFFE #003 Kree Soldier on click #1.

January 28, 2022
Monkey Joe
[B][COLOR="Sienna"]Wasn�t Mar-Vell branded a traitor to the Kree? Why would he get to call Kree soldiers to his aid?[/COLOR][/B]
January 9, 2022
Roderic_Cliche
Great piece. I've always enjoyed playing Mar-Vell's variants over the years, and this is a splendid update. My one beef with it is philosophical. This figure's appearance is based on the cover to [I]Captain Marvel[/I] #29 (November, 1973), which is the issue when Eon convinces him to turn his back on the ways of war, to take up the role of cosmic protector, and in doing so to take on the power of cosmic awareness. This is when his hair goes blond and he gets minor costume changes, as well as a more dignified and noble persona rather than that of simply being a great warrior and soldier for the Kree Empire. In short, this figure's Kree-Skrull War trait and the prime's "I can't just watch them die. . . I must act!" trait probably should have been swapped in terms of character accuracy. While this figure certainly benefits greatly from calling in Kree Soldiers, boosting his range and damage potential, they are completely anachronistic for Mar-Vell at this time in his life.
December 29, 2021
TheFreak

December 13, 2021
Faster Than Flash
Quick rules question here that I know will come up: "The chosen character can't use Super Senses or Shape Change when targeted by Mar-Vell and friendly Sidekicks this turn." Since it says Super Senses "or" Shape Change Rather than Super Senses "and" Shape Change I'd assume you pick one or the other; although I don't know for certain. I believe the "intent" is to turn off both
October 28, 2021
Goop
This guy is great, the fact that he has Psyblast and can turn off SS and Shape Change means he will be getting through most defenses and doesn't care about SAFEGUARD: Outwit or even Stealth. So many figures rely on those powers and they are completely shut down by him. Good selection of powers, Cosmic Energy, sidekick generation. He's a solid choice, a real Skrull killer.
October 28, 2021
Redrover454
I like him. Between PB and his trait turning off SS and SC it'll be hard for opponents to keep him from getting his damage through. Generating Kree Soldiers on his leadership is really nice too, they can S.H.I.E.L.D. TA on him and bring his range and damage up to 8 and 5. His defense is kinda meh but with his resurrection trait and Cosmic Energy you should be able to keep swinging with him without worrying too much about him getting dropped.
